markov

Class NestedProbFun<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • markov.Node<T>
      • markov.MarkovNode<T>
        • markov.NestedProbFun<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - as the type of elements that will be contained in the NestedProbFun.

    public class NestedProbFun<T>
extends MarkovNode<T>
    Author:
    Alexander Johnston Copyright 2020 A class for creating NestedProbFuns for NestedMarkovNodes, NLayerMarkovChains, or stand-alone 2-layer markov chains and adjusting the probabilities based on feedback of the past.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NestedProbFun(ProbFun<T> probFun)
      Creates a NestedProbFun where the values returned by probFun when fun() is called are mapped to new ProbFuns.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NestedProbFun

        public NestedProbFun(ProbFun<T> probFun)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a NestedProbFun where the values returned by probFun when fun() is called are mapped to new ProbFuns. Changes to elements in probFun will be reflected in this NestedProbFun.
        Parameters:
        probFun - as the ProbFun whose output values are mapped to copies of ProbFun. (Ex: A ProbFun with output choices [0,1] will create a map [[0]->[0,1], [1]->[0,1]]).
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if probFun is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • getFirstLink

        public ProbFun<T> getFirstLink()
        Specified by:
        getFirstLink in class MarkovNode<T>

      • getChain

        public java.util.Map<T,Node<T>> getChain()
        Specified by:
        getChain in class MarkovNode<T>
        Returns:
        the chain that makes up the Map from the output values of a ProbFun to probabilities or Nodes.

      • good

        public void good(T sourceElement,
                 T destinationElement,
                 double percent)
        Adjust the probabilities to make sourceElement more likely to return destinationElement when fun() is called.
        Parameters:
        sourceElement - as the sourceElement in this NestedProbFun which may be null to adjust the probability of the ProbFun that generates the first element.
        destinationElement - as the destinationElement in this NestedProbFun.
        percent - as the percentage between 0 and 1 exclusive, of the probability of sourceElement returning destinationElement to add to the probability.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if destinationElement is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive.

      • bad

        public void bad(T sourceElement,
                T destinationElement,
                double percent)
        Adjust the probabilities to make sourceElement less likely to return destinationElement when fun() is called.
        Parameters:
        sourceElement - as the sourceElement in this NestedProbFun which may be null to adjust the probability of the first returned element.
        destinationElement - as the destinationElement in this NestedProbFun.
        percent - as the percentage between 0 and 1 exclusive, of the probability of sourceElement returning destinationElement to subtract from the probability.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if destinationElement is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive.

      • fun

        public T fun()
        Specified by:
        fun in class Node<T>
        Returns:
        a randomly picked element from this NestedProbFun which is based on the previously returned element. Note that any changes in the element will be reflected in this NestedProbFun.
